content: i walk the line designed by shuyi wu notes these may look like simple chevron socks but they re hiding a secret if you look at the crazy zigzags from an angle you will see wide vertical stripes appear like the song they represent johnny cash s promise to his first wife to remain faithful despite the many temptations that he faced as a musician on the road the socks are worked cuff-down with a standard flap and gusset heel the chevron pattern is worked in 2-row stripes and borrows from the shadow knitting technique to create the illusion of vertical stripes there are 2 sizes m l with 72 84 stitches per round to fit a foot circumference of 8 5 10 inches or 22 25 cm the chevron pattern is quite stretchy in both directions so it will accommodate a larger or smaller foot circumference as needed leg and foot length are adjustable the sample socks are shown in size m the leg/instep pattern is charted and written you may use any technique you prefer for knitting a small circumference in the round supplies two colours of sock yarn with good contrast fingering weight wool/nylon mix - 75 g main colour mc - 50 g contrast colour cc - for the sample socks mc is zauberball crazy in colourway u-boot cc is white sock yarn of unknown brand 2 5 mm us1 5 needles or size needed to obtain gauge 2 25 mm us1 needles or 1-2 sizes smaller than previous optional stitch markers yarn needle i walk the line v1 0 - shuyi wu - 1 abbreviations st s = stitch es bor = beginning of round k = knit p = purl sl = slip 1 stitch purlwise with yarn to ws ktbl = knit through the back loop ptbl = purl through the back loop yo = yarn over bring the yarn over the working needle from front to back byo = backward yarn over bring the yarn over the working needle from back to front p2tog = purl 2 together k2tog = knit 2 together ssk = slip 1 knitwise slip 1 knitwise knit slipped stitches together through back loops cdd = slip 2 knitwise together knit 1 pass 2 slipped stitches over central double decrease rs = right side ws = wrong side special stitches for the chevron pattern i chose to use directional yarn over increases they have the same structure as m1l/m1pl and m1r/m1pr except they are worked over two row make a yarn over in the first row and knit/purl it in the second this yields the same symmetry as m1 increases but with extra slack so the increase columns are just as stretchy as the decrease columns the left-leaning increase is formed by a yo in the first row and a ktbl or ptbl in the second which twists the stitch to the left the right-leaning increase is formed by a byo in the first row and a k
